trending.name: Weet-Bix And Mango Smoothie Bowl
trending.summary:
0:05 Prep - 1 Serving
Difficulty: Super easy
Published by: Coles
trending.ingredients:
- 200g frozen mango
- 90g (1/3 cup) dairy-free natural yoghurt
- 80ml (1/3 cup) almond milk
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 2 Sanitarium Cholesterol Lowering Weet-bix
- Sliced fresh mango, to serve
- Fresh blueberries, to serve
- Coconut flakes, to serve
- Natural sliced almonds, to serve
trending.instructions:
Step 1:
Use a blender to blend frozen mango, yoghurt, almond milk and maple syrup until smooth. Spoon into a serving bowl.

trending.name: Peppered Steak With Creamy Mushroom Sauce
trending.summary:
0:10 Prep - 0:15 Cook - 4 Servings
Difficulty: Capable Cooks
Published by: Coles
trending.ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon cracked black pepper
- 4 scotch fillet steaks, trimmed
- 50g butter, chopped
- 3 garlic cloves, crushed
- 200g button mushrooms, thinly sliced
- 150g shiitake mushrooms, stalks removed, thinly sliced
- 4 sprigs thyme
- 2 tablespoons red wine or Massel beef stock
- 1/3 cup thickened cream
- Mashed potato, to serve
- Baby spinach, to serve
trending.instructions:
Step 1:
Rub both sides of the steaks with cracked black pepper and season with salt. Heat 30g butter in a heavy-based frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook steaks for 2 to 3 minutes each side for medium or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate. Cover with foil.

Step 2:
Add remaining 20g butter, garlic, mushrooms and thyme to pan. Cook, stirring often, for 4 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Add wine. Cook until wine is almost evaporated. Add cream. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 1 minute or until sauce begins to thicken.

Step 3:
Spoon mashed potato onto plates. Top with steak and spoon over mushroom sauce. Serve with spinach.
trending.nutrition:

Fat Total: 33g
Saturated Fat: 17g

snack.name: Fruit And Nut Snack Mix
snack.summary:
0:05 Prep - Makes 2 cups
Difficulty: Easy
Published by: Coles
snack.ingredients:
- 35g (1 cup) Kellogg's Nutri-Grain cereal
- 150g (1 cup) FreshLife Bushies Blend Fruit, Nut & Seed Mix
- 2 tablespoons shredded coconut
snack.instructions:
Step 1:
Combine Kellogg's Nutri-Grain cereal, FreshLife Bushies Blend Fruit, Nut & Seed Mix and shredded coconut in an airtight container. Scoop 1/2 cup of the mixture into a small serving bowl to serve.

snack.name: Snack Box Muffins
snack.summary:
0:15 Prep - 0:30 Cook - Makes 6
Difficulty: Advanced
Published by: Coles
snack.ingredients:
- Olive oil spray
- 225g (1 1/2 cups) self-raising flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 175g Kent pumpkin, peeled, seeded, coarsely grated
- 125g can corn kernels, drained
- 50g prosciutto or shaved ham, coarsely chopped
- 25g (1/4 cup) coarsely grated cheddar
- 2 shallots, trimmed, finely chopped
- 2 eggs
- 185ml (3/4 cup) milk
- 90g (1/3 cup) Greek-style yoghurt
- 2 tablespoons pumpkin kernels (pepitas)
snack.instructions:
Step 1:
Preheat oven to 180°C. Spray six 185ml (3/4-cup) muffin pans with oil. 

Step 2:
Combine the flour and baking powder in a large bowl. Stir in the pumpkin, corn, prosciutto or ham, cheddar and shallot. Make a well in the centre. 

Step 3:
Whisk the eggs, milk and yoghurt in a jug. Pour into the well in the flour mixture and stir until just combined. Spoon among the prepared pans. Sprinkle with pumpkin kernels. 

Step 4:
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centres comes out clean. Set aside in pans for 5 minutes to cool before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
snack.nutrition:
Energy: 1085 kj 
Fat Total: 8.5g
Saturated Fat: 3.5g
Fibre: 2.5g
Protein: 12g
Carbs (TOTAL): 34g

breakfast.name: Fruity Smoothie Bowl
breakfast.summary:
0:10 Prep - Capable Cook - 2 Servings
Difficulty: Easy
Published by: Coles
breakfast.ingredients:
- 2 bananas
- 125g frozen raspberries
- 1 cup (250ml) H2coco Pure Coconut Water
- 1/2 cup (125ml) almond milk
- 2 tablespoons LSA meal (see tip)
- 1 cup (130g) granola
- 100g blueberries
- 100g strawberries, hulled, quartered
- Plain yoghurt (optional), to serve
breakfast.instructions:
Step 1:
Thinly slice 1/2 banana. Coarsely chop remaining 1 1/2 bananas. 

Step 2:
Place the coarsely chopped banana in a blender. Add the raspberries, H2coco Pure Coconut Water, almond milk, LSA mix and half the granola. Blend until smooth. 

Step 3: 
Divide the smoothie mixture evenly between 2 serving bowls. Arrange the blueberries, strawberry, remaining granola and the sliced banana in even rows on top of the smoothie. Gently swirl a little yoghurt into the uncovered smoothie, if desired.
breakfast.notes: TOP TIP: LSA meal is a mix of linseed, sunflower seeds and almond meal that is great for giving smoothies a nutrient boost. Find it in the health food aisle or alternatively, use almond meal.

breakfast.name: Smoked Salmon Toasts
breakfast.summary:
0:15 Prep - 0:20 Cook - Makes 24
Difficulty: Easy
Published by: Coles
breakfast.ingredients:
- 1 Coles Bakery Rustic Baguette*, thinly sliced diagonally
- 80g goat’s cheese
- 125g crème fraîche or sour cream
- 250g Coles Thinly Sliced Smoked Salmon
- 2 tbs finely chopped dill
- 2 tbs finely chopped chives
- 1 lemon, zested, juiced
- 2 tbs extra virgin olive oil
breakfast.instructions:
Step 1:
Heat a chargrill on high. Lightly spray the bread with olive oil spray. Cook on the grill, in batches, for 1 min each side or until bread is toasted. Place on a serving platter. 

Step 2:
Combine the goat’s cheese and crème fraîche or sour cream in a bowl. Use a fork to whisk until the mixture thickens slightly. Spread goat’s cheese mixture evenly over one side of the bread. Top with salmon. 

Step 3:
Combine the dill, chive, lemon zest, lemon juice and oil in a small bowl. Season. Spoon over the salmon to serve.
breakfast.nutrition:
Energy: 408 kj 
Fat Total: 6g
Saturated Fat: 3g
Fibre: 0.4g

Carbs (TOTAL): 6g
breakfast.notes: SERVE WITH lemon wedges and baby rocket leaves.

lunch.name: Chicken Caesar Veggie Wraps
lunch.summary:
0:30 Prep - 0:20 Cook - 4 Servings
Difficulty: Easy
Published by: Coles
lunch.ingredients:
- 2 corn cobs, husks and silks removed
- 1 tablespoon olive oil, divided
- 4 Coles Australian RSPCA Approved Chicken Thigh Fillets (about 550g), trimmed
- 4 Coles White Soft Wraps, lightly toasted on barbecue
- 3 heads baby gem lettuce, leaves separated
- 1 Lebanese cucumber, cut into thin wedges
- 200g Perino tomatoes, halved
lunch.instructions:
Step 1:
To make the dressing, in a blender, blend yoghurt, parmesan, lemon juice, mustard, oil, anchovies and garlic until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. 

Step 2:
Prepare a barbecue for medium-high heat. Coat corn with 2 teaspoons oil. Season with salt and pepper. Barbecue, turning occasionally, for 18 mins or until charred. Cut kernels off cobs into a bowl. 

Step 3:
Meanwhile, coat chicken with the remaining oil and season with salt and pepper. Barbecue for 5-6 mins each side or until cooked through. Set aside for 5 mins to rest. Thinly slice chicken. 

Step 4:
Lay the wraps on a work surface. Top with lettuce, corn, chicken and cucumber. Fold bottom third over filling and roll up. Drizzle dressing into wraps as desired and serve with tomatoes.
lunch.nutrition:
Energy: 2551 kj 
Fat Total: 25g
Saturated Fat: 7g
Fibre: 12g
Protein: 42g
Sodium: 661mg

Carbs (TOTAL): 47g
lunch.notes:
Excellent source protein & fibre 
1 veg serve

Dressing to go- Pack wraps and dressing separately. Keep chilled until ready to eat, then drizzle the wrap with dressing as you go. Dip the tomatoes in dressing too.

lunch.name: Chunky Gazpacho With Rice
lunch.summary:
0:45 Prep - Capable Cook - 4 Servings
Difficulty: Easy
Published by: Coles
lunch.ingredients:
- 1 red capsicum, seeds removed, roughly chopped
- 1 yellow capsicum, seeds, removed, roughly chopped
- 1 Lebanese cucumber, peeled, seeds removed, roughly chopped
- 1 long red chilli, seeds removed, roughly chopped
- 1 garlic clove, roughly chopped
- 1/2 small onion, roughly chopped
- 2 cups (500ml) tomato juice
- 1/2 cup (125ml) tomato puree
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 2 cups cooked white long-grain rice
- 1/3 cup (80ml) extra virgin olive oil
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Tabasco, to taste
lunch.instructions:
Step 1:
Place half of each of the capsicum, cucumber and chilli in a food processor with the garlic, onion, tomato juice, tomato puree and vinegar. Process until smooth, adjust seasoning then place in freezer for 30 minutes to chill. 

Step 2:
When ready to serve, divide the cooked rice between 4 soup bowls and top with the remaining capsicum, cucumber and chilli. Ladle the chilled soup over the top, drizzle with olive oil and season to taste with lemon juice and Tabasco.
lunch.nutrition:

Fat Total: 19g
Saturated Fat: 3g
Fibre: 3g
Protein: 4g
Sodium: 320.21mg
Carbs (SUGAR): 6g
Carbs (TOTAL): 33g

dinner.name: Cajun-Style Beef With Corn Mash
dinner.summary:
0:25 Prep - 0:30 Cook - 4 Servings
Difficulty: Medium
Published by: Coles
dinner.ingredients:
- 4 beef T-bone steaks
- 2 tablespoons Cajun seasoning (see note)
- 750g Desiree potatoes, peeled, cut into 4cm pieces
- 1/4 cup light thickened cream
- 300g can creamed corn
- 1 long red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped
- 1 birdseye red chilli, deseeded, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup finely chopped chives
- Olive oil cooking spray
- Baby spinach leaves, to serve
dinner.instructions:
Step 1:
Place steaks onto a plate. Sprinkle Cajun seasoning over both sides of steaks, pressing on with your fingertips. Cover. Refrigerate for 15 minutes. 

Step 2:
Place potatoes into a large saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over medium heat. Cover with a lid. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash until smooth. Add cream, corn, chillies, chives, and salt and pepper. Stir well. 

Step3:
Preheat a barbecue plate or frying pan on medium-high heat. Spray both sides of steaks with oil. Cook for 4 minutes each side for medium. Serve with corn mash and baby spinach.
dinner.nutrition:
Energy: 2783 kj 
Fat Total: 33g
Saturated Fat: 14g
Fibre: 7g
Protein: 54g
Cholesterol: 132mg
Sodium: 636.13mg
Carbs (SUGAR): 8g
Carbs (TOTAL): 35g
dinner.notes: Note: Cajun seasoning has a medium heat rating. If you don't like spicy food, try reducing the amount to 1 tablespoon.

dinner.name: Teriyaki Fried Rice With Omelette
dinner.summary:
0:05 Prep - 0:05 Cook - 4 Servings
Difficulty: Easy
Published by: Coles
dinner.ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 2 green shallots
- 100g snow peas
- 1 small fresh red chilli (optional)
- 1 tablespoon peanut oil
- 2 x 250g packet microwave Uncle Ben’s Rice Medley
- 1 bunch broccolini
- 150g (1 cup) frozen baby peas 
- 145g (1 cup) roasted cashews
- 2 tablespoons bought teriyaki marinade
- 2 tablespoons Capilano Dark & Bold Honey
- Black sesame seeds, to sprinkle
dinner.instructions:
Step 1:
Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat. 

Step 2:
While the pan heats up, whisk the eggs in a jug. Season well. Thinly slice the shallots. Thinly slice the snow peas lengthways. Finely chop the chilli, if using.

Step 3:
Heat the oil in the pan. Pour in the egg and swirl to coat pan in a thin layer. Cook for 2 minutes or until set and golden underneath. 

Step 4:
While the omelette cooks, place 1 packet of rice in the microwave and warm following packet directions. Repeat with the remaining packet. 

Step 5:
Remove the omelette from the pan and shred.

Step 6:
Add the broccolini and snow peas to the pan. Stir-fry for 2 minutes or until bright green and tender crisp. Transfer to a plate. Add the shallot, peas, cashews and rice to the pan. Stir-fry for 1 minute or until combined. Add the teriyaki marinade and honey. Toss until the rice mixture is well coated. Top with the broccolini, snow peas and omelette. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and chilli, if using, to serve.
dinner.nutrition:
Energy: 2187 kj 
Fat Total: 28.6g
Saturated Fat: 5.1g
Fibre: 7.4g
Protein: 18.1g
Carbs (TOTAL): 46g
